Why I want to join the CDS.

In General.

CDS CO-OP/Internship Application for Summer 2018

In General.

After learning about the Canadian Digital Service at the Carleton Net Night. I found it amazing that something like the CDS existed. A similar to startup environment where everyone is collaborating together to work on impactful projects submitted by other departments of the Government of Canada is a fascinating thing to myself. In addition, learning about how agile the CDS is in the technology that it uses, using both the requested frameworks and languages but also able to use newer technology such as NodeJS and Ruby into an environment like the Government where it's not a standard. Furthermore, after talking with Yeremia at the Net Night, I could tell how interested and dedicated the team is to improve on the past solutions and finding better ways to do things that could have never been imagined before (Like the project that brings ministers paperwork and notes into the digital world reminded me of one of my old side projects for my old high school bringing their paper morning announcement system online.). Therefore, the reason that I truly want to be apart of the CDS is to join a team that is focused on making a true impact in the way that the Government of Canada uses technology.

The Team

Dedication

No make-work projects, fully functional and properly designed as well as implemented.

Collaboration

The entire team works together to find the best solution to a problem and also get the different opinions to create a project that is suitable for everyone.

Tech.

With the increase in amazing new languages and frameworks that can be used now adays, it's key to both adapt but also be able to maintain and create systems both on older tech such as pearl and PHP but also be able to invest and use newer ones like NodeJS and Rails.

Impact

One of the biggest benefits of being part of the Government of Canada is the fact that the Canadian Digital Services has the ability to make a true impact by working on projects that are used not just by government officials but also the population.
